content.text: ⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: heroVideo.webm. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);
⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: heroVideo.webm. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);

I can see the issue! The error shows that `heroVideo.webm` is being treated as a locale parameter, which means your Next.js routing is incorrectly capturing the video file request as a locale route.

The problem is that your `[locale]` dynamic route is catching ALL requests, including static assets like `heroVideo.webm`. This happens when the video file is being requested from the root or when the routing configuration isn't properly excluding static assets.

Let me first check your project structure to understand how the routing is set up:
Let me check the middleware configuration and the public directory to understand how static assets are handled:
Let me check if there are any video files in the public directory or if they're referenced elsewhere:
Now I found the issue! Let me check the hero component:

Perfect! I found the root cause. The issue is in the video source path in `hero.tsx`. The path `"./heroVideo.webm"` is being interpreted as a relative path that gets caught by the `[locale]` dynamic route.

Here are the solutions:

## Solution 1: Fix the video source paths (Recommended)

The video files should be served from the `/public` directory and referenced with absolute paths starting with `/`:
Let me get the exact text with proper whitespace:
Let me check the exact whitespace characters:

content.lineBasedDiff: --- components/hero.tsx +++ components/hero.tsx @@ -270,7 +270,7 @@ className="rounded-[30px] w-full h-full object-cover" > {/* Add multiple sources for different devices */} - +
--- components/hero.tsx +++ components/hero.tsx @@ -271,7 +271,7 @@ > {/* Add multiple sources for different devices */} - +

content.text: Now I need to check if the video files actually exist in the public directory. Let me check:

⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: heroVideo.webm. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);
⨯ Failed to generate static paths for /[locale]:
⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: sw.js. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);
⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: sw.js. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);
⨯ Error: Unsupported locale: heroVideo.webm. Supported locales: en, nl
> 84 |          throw new Error(`Unsupported locale: ${locale}. Supported locales: ${SUPPORTED_LOCALES.join(', ')}`);

I can see that the issue persists even after fixing the video paths. The problem is that your middleware configuration is still catching static assets like `sw.js` and `heroVideo.webm`. The current matcher pattern `["/((?!api|_next|_vercel|.*\\..*).*)"]` is supposed to exclude files with extensions, but it's not working correctly.

Let me fix the middleware configuration to properly exclude static assets:
The regex pattern looks correct, but let me try a more explicit approach that's known to work better with Next.js middleware:
Let me try a different approach that's more explicit and commonly used for next-intl:

content.lineBasedDiff:
--- middleware.ts
+++ middleware.ts
@@ -9,9 +9,10 @@
    matcher: [
       // Match all pathnames except for
       // - API routes
-      // - _next (Next.js internals)  
-      // - _vercel (Vercel internals)
-      // - Static files (files with extensions)
-      '/((?!api|_next|_vercel|.*\\..*).*)' 
+      // - _next (Next.js internals)
+      // - _vercel (Vercel internals) 
+      // - Static files (favicon.ico, sw.js, etc.)
+      // - Files with extensions (.webm, .mp4, .png, etc.)
+      '/((?!api|_next|_vercel|favicon.ico|sw.js|.*\\.[^/]+$).*)'
    ]
 };

content.text: Now let me also check if you have the video files in your public directory. If not, we need to add them:

diffs.patch:
@@ -176,44 +176,325 @@
 r: %5B
-%22/((?!api%7C_next%7C_vercel%7C.*%5C%5C..*).*)%22
+%0A      // Match all pathnames except for%0A      // - API routes%0A      // - _next (Next.js internals)%0A      // - _vercel (Vercel internals) %0A      // - Static files (favicon.ico, sw.js, etc.)%0A      // - Files with extensions (.webm, .mp4, .png, etc.)%0A      '/((?!api%7C_next%7C_vercel%7Cfavicon.ico%7Csw.js%7C.*%5C%5C.%5B%5E/%5D+$).*)'%0A   
 %5D%0A%7D;
